bugs.title: CVE-2015-0847 nbd: nbd-server denial of service due to unsafe signal handlers

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2015-0847 nbd: nbd-server denial of service due to unsafe signal handlers

long_desc.thetext:
It was reported that nbd-server in the nbd package does unsafe signal
handling, calling non-reentrant operations from signal handlers and
therefore risking undefined operation and crashes.

References:
http://sourceforge.net/p/nbd/mailman/message/34091218/

Created nbd tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1222028]
Affects: epel-6 [bug 1222029]
Affects: epel-7 [bug 1222030]
nbd-3.11-1.fc21 has been pushed to the Fedora 21 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
nbd-3.11-1.fc22 has been pushed to the Fedora 22 stable repository.  If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
nbd-3.11-1.el7 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 7 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of Fedora EPEL.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

epel-7 tracking bug for nbd: see blocks bug list for full details of the security issue(s).

This bug is never intended to be made public, please put any public notes
in the blocked bugs.

[bug automatically created by: add-tracking-bugs]

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1222027,1222030

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for CVE-2015-0847

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi update submission link instead:

https://admin.fedoraproject.org/updates/new/?type_=security&bugs=1222027,1222030

* was pushed to the Fedora EPEL 7 testing repository,
